New Records: Shohei Ohtani stole his 56th base of the season, tying him with Ichiro Suzuki for the most in a season by a Japanese-born player.
Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a 448-foot home run, the longest by a Padres player this season.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani singled in the go-ahead run in the sixth inning.
Michael Kopech struck out Donovan Solano with a 101 mph fastball to end the game.
Fernando Tatis Jr. hit a home run in the fifth inning to tie the game at 3-3.
Gavin Lux had an RBI single in the fourth inning.
Shohei Ohtani doubled in the fourth inning, scoring Gavin Lux.
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said, 'You want to think about it. It’s right in front of us. We’ll be ready.'
Padres slugger Fernando Tatis Jr. said, 'We’re just going to keep coming. We’re definitely going to bring the same energy tomorrow and keep going like that.'
Shohei Ohtani said through a translator, 'He’s somebody I admire and look up to. I will continue to steal when the occasion is necessary.'
Shohei Ohtani said, 'There’s some sense of elevation when it comes to playing these meaningful games. I’m really focused on quality at-bats.'
Dodgers manager Dave Roberts said of Blake Treinen, 'Tonight was a clinic. He’s using his entire toolbox.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers moved within a victory of clinching the NL West.
The Padres' five-game winning streak ended.
The Dodgers need a win in Thursday’s series finale to earn their 11th division title in 12 years.
The Padres remain 3 1/2 games ahead of Arizona and the New York Mets for the NL’s top wild-card spot.
Ohtani leads the major leagues with 130 runs scored, leaving him one shy of the Los Angeles Dodgers record set by Freddie Freeman last season.
Others: Dodgers reliever Blake Treinen pitched a 1-2-3 eighth inning.
Dodgers starter Jack Flaherty gave up three runs and four hits in five innings.
Padres starter Dylan Cease allowed three runs and five hits in five innings.
Dodgers: SS Miguel Rojas left the game with left groin tightness and will have an MRI and receive an injection.
Padres: RHP Joe Musgrove (6-5, 3.95 ERA) has thrown six scoreless innings in three of his four outings this month.
Dodgers: RHP Walker Buehler (1-6, 5.63) is still looking for his second win in his final start of the regular season.
